 This statistic shows the median age of the population in the Netherlands from 1950 to 2050. The median age of a population is an index that divides the population in two equal groups: half of the population is older than the median age and the other half younger. It is a very important indicator for policy makers, since it shows the age structure of a country. In 2015, the median age of the Netherlands population was 27.1 years.

 This statistic shows the total assets of the Bank of America from 2011 to 2019. In 2019, the total assets of the Bank of America amounted to approximately 377.1 billion U.S. dollars. 
caption en
 Between March and May 2020, the number of passengers at Polish airports decreased by 90 percent compared to the previous year. The drop in passenger traffic was the largest in the country's history. The number of passengers at all airports in Poland decreased by 90 percent in comparison to the previous year. The largest decrease was recorded in Gdańsk, where the number of passengers decreased by 99 percent. 
caption en

During the survey, 70 percent of respondents stated that they believed that AI would improve their customer experience.

As of December 29, 2020, there had been 10,787,387 confirmed cases of the virus in the United States.  This statistic shows the results of a survey conducted in the United Kingdom (UK) in 2013 on the online shopping behavior of online shoppers in the United Kingdom (UK). The survey was conducted among online shoppers in the week prior to the survey. The results are presented as a distribution of online shopping behavior. In this case, the respondents were asked to indicate the share of their online purchases that were online only. The results show that 100 percent of the respondents who exclusively purchased online (100 respondents) purchased at least one item of clothing and footwear online.

 This statistic shows the median age of the population in the Netherlands from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Netherlands population was 39.6 years. 
caption en
 The number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 in the United States increased from 1,000 cases on March 1, 2020 to 3,700,000 on December 27, 2020. The number of confirmed cases in the United States has been increasing since March 1, 2020. 
caption en
 The statistic shows the growth rate of the gross domestic product (GDP) in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) in 2020 and 2021. The GDP of the UAE is expected to grow by 1.5 percent in 2021 compared to 2020. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the total population of the Democratic Republic of the Congo from 2015 to 2025. In 2018, the total population of the Democratic Republic of the Congo was at approximately 0.57 million inhabitants. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the world's tallest buildings as of 2016, by height. The Bank of China Center in Beijing, China, is the tallest building in the world, at 810 meters. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the average life expectancy at birth in the Netherlands from 2008 to 2018, by gender. It reveals that overall the life expectancy at birth for women was higher than that of men in all years measured. In 2018, life expectancy at birth for women in the Netherlands was about 79.55 years, while life expectancy at birth for men was about 70.44 years.

 This statistic shows the development of New Brunswick's real GDP from 2000 to 2019. In 2019, the real GDP of New Brunswick was 114.88 billion U.S. dollars.

 This statistic shows the median age of the population in the United States from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the U.S. population was 32.4 years.

In 2019, the average annual cost per capita for personal protective equipment in the U.S. was 1,056.07 U.S. dollars. Personal protective equipment Personal protective equipment (PPE) is a type of clothing or equipment that is designed to protect the wearer from injury or illness. PPE is used in a variety of industries, including construction, healthcare, and agriculture. PPE is used to protect against a variety of hazards, including heat, cold, and chemicals. PPE can be used in a variety of ways, including: 1. Work boots: Work boots are designed to protect the feet from injury while working. They are made of a variety of materials, including leather, rubber, and synthetic fibers. 2. Work gloves: Work gloves are designed to protect the hands from injury while working. They are made of a variety of materials, including leather, rubber, and synthetic fibers. 3. Work pants: Work pants are designed to protect the legs from injury while working. caption en
 This statistic presents data on the degree of inequality in wealth distribution based on the Gini coefficient in the Netherlands from 2000 to 2017. This coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of inequality. In 2016 and 2017, the Netherlands had a Gini coefficient of 46.6, which indicates a degree of inequality of distribution of income in the country that year which is between 46 and 50 percent higher than an ideal distribution.

 The statistic illustrates the total amount of investments of the private equity firms based in Italy from 2007 to 2016. Private equity is the OTC provision of equity capital through private or institutional investments with the participation of companies in another company for a limited time in order to generate financial benefits. It can be seen that total private equity investments fluctuated overall during the period under observation, reaching a value of more than 1.3 billion euros as of 2016. The largest total amount of private equity investments was recorded in 2012, when total private equity investments amounted to approximately 1.4 billion euros.

In 2019, the GDP per capita in the United States amounted to around 3,678.66 U.S. dollars.

It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Bahamas population was 27.6 years.

 This statistic shows the results of a survey, conducted annually from 1992 to 2019, asking the question: "Do you think that the government should provide free education to all children?" The results are presented in two categories: those who think that the government should provide free education to all children and those who do not think that the government should provide free education to all children. In 2019, 77 percent of respondents stated that the government should provide free education to all children.

 This statistic shows the median age of the population in the Bahamas from 1950 to 2050*.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Bahamas population was 27.6 years.

 This statistic shows the median age of the population in the Netherlands from 1950 to 2050. The median age of the population is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Netherlands population was 29.4 years.

 The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) in the Bahamas from 2004 to 2019, with projections up until 2021. Gross domestic product (GDP) denotes the aggregate value of all services and goods produced within a country in any given year. GDP is an important indicator of a country's economic power. In 2019, Bahamas's gross domestic product amounted to around 742.15 billion international dollars. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the results of the general election held in the United Kingdom (UK) on May 7, 1974. In 1974, the Conservative Party had the highest share of votes, with 52 percent of the votes. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the results of a survey conducted in the United States in 2018 regarding the education level of the U.S. population. 35.3 percent of the male respondents stated they had a high school diploma or less. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the results of a survey conducted in the United States in 2019 about the use of e-readers. During the survey, 20 percent of respondents aged 18 to 29 years said they used e-readers. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the per capita consumption of peanuts and groundnuts in Norway from 1970 to 2018. In 2018, the per capita consumption of peanuts and groundnuts amounted to 7.9 kilograms. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the development of Kansas' GDP from 2000 to 2019. In 2019, the gross domestic product of Kansas was 486 billion U.S. dollars. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the total gross domestic product (GDP) per capita of Canada in 2019, distinguished by province. In 2019, the GDP per capita in Ontario was about 744.44 Canadian dollars. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. GDP is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the annual average amount of money spent per consumer on food and beverages in the United States from 2015 to 2019. In 2019, the average annual amount of money spent on food and beverages was 199 U.S. dollars per consumer. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the share of women in the U.S. House of Representatives from 1991 to 2018. In 2018, 15.6 percent of the House of Representatives were women. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the results of a survey on the operating system used by mobile developers in the United Kingdom (UK) in 2018 and 2019, and a forecast for 2020. In 2020, it is expected that 60 percent of mobile developers will use Windows as their primary operating system. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the share of the population in the United States who were registered to vote in the 2012 election. In 2012, 41 percent of registered voters were Republican, and 38 percent were Democrat. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the fertility rate in Puerto Rico from 2008 to 2018. The fertility rate is the average number of children born by one woman while being of child-bearing age. In 2018, the fertility rate in Puerto Rico amounted to 1.04 children per woman. 
caption en
 As of June 2020, the most popular K-pop group on Instagram was Jennie of Blackpink with 27.15 million followers. The South Korean girl group BTS was ranked second with 25.89 million followers.

 This statistic shows the results of a survey among American travelers on the use of leisure and business travel plans in 2014. During the survey, 51 percent of respondents said they used leisure travel plans. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the percentage change in the number of people in the United States who were unemployed from January 2010 to July 2015. In July 2015, the number of unemployed people increased by 2 percent compared to the previous month. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the importance of various factors to consumers when making an online purchase in the United Kingdom (UK) in 2015. Of respondents, 14 percent said that product quality was the most important factor when making an online purchase. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the number of cases of human rights violations in Russia in 2019, by category. In 2019, 101,498 cases of restriction of access to the internet were reported in Russia. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the average cost per user of online video streaming services in the United Kingdom (UK) in the first quarter of 2013 and the first quarter of 2014. In the first quarter of 2014, the average cost per user of online video streaming services was 1.04 British pounds.

 This statistic shows the total mobile money sent in the United States in 2014 and 2019, by device. In 2019, U.S. mobile money senders sent a total of 9.99 billion U.S. dollars via mobile devices.

 The statistic shows the revenue of the New York Knicks franchise from the 2001/02 season to the 2018/19 season. In 2018/19, the estimated revenue of the National Basketball Association franchise amounted to 285 million U.S. dollars.

 The statistic shows the number of Facebook fans/Twitter followers of the NBA franchise Portland Trail Blazers from August 2012 to August 2020. In August 2020, the Facebook page of the Portland Trail Blazers basketball team had more than 2.1 million fans.

 This statistic shows the results of a survey among American adults on whether they think the United States should or should not have a federal minimum wage. 22 percent of respondents said they think the United States should have a federal minimum wage.

 This statistic shows the size of the global medical device market in 2013 and 2020. In 2020, the global medical device market is expected to be worth 9.3 billion U.S. dollars.

 This statistic shows the share of the global population living with extreme poverty in 2016, by region. In 2016, 37.6 percent of the global population living with extreme poverty was located in Latin America.

 This statistic shows the number of offenses committed by right-wing and left-wing extremist background in the United States in 2019, by type. In 2019, 16 offenses were committed by a person with a left-wing extremist background. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the damages caused by the largest bank robberies in history. The largest bank robbery in history was the robbery of 200 million U.S. dollars in Peru in 1992. 
caption en
 The statistic shows the youth unemployment rate in South Africa from 1999 and 2020. According to the source, the data are ILO estimates. In 2020, the estimated youth unemployment rate in South Africa was at 16.31 percent.

 This statistic shows the results of a survey among American adults on the time of the day they drink coffee. The survey was conducted in 2012. 77 percent of the respondents said they drink coffee at breakfast time.

 The statistic shows the national debt of the United States from 2014 to 2018, with projections up until 2024. In 2018, the national debt of the United States amounted to 23.08 trillion U.S. dollars. 
caption en
 This statistic shows the results of a survey among adult Americans on whether they think the United States should have a federal minimum wage. The survey was conducted in 2019. 46 percent of respondents aged 18 to 29 years stated that they think the United States should have a federal minimum wage. 
caption en
 Life expectancy in the United States was 38.6 years in 1850, and by 2020 it is expected to be 81.4 years. This is an increase of 42 years since 1850. 
caption en
 This statistic represents the number of registered automobiles in the United States in 2016, with a breakdown by type. In that year, there were approximately 4.6 million private and commercial automobiles (including taxicabs) registered in the United States. 
caption en
 As of January 1, 2021, the total number of COVID-19 cases in the United States amounted to 136,921. Of these, 127,402 were recovered, and 1,483 were in critical condition.
